alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 21 at 10:48AM MST until December 21 at 1:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, ground blizzard conditions due to blowing and drifting snow. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 1 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Warning, until 6 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Localized whiteout conditions are expected in blowing and drifting snow. Severe driving conditions are occurring on sections of highways 41 and 287. Roads remain snow covered and icy. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Near record cold daytime maximum and overnight minimum temperatures are likely today through Thursday. Minimum temperatures of 30 below to 40 below zero expected tonight with isolated colder readings possible.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
